documents.document: RT @SocDems: Living in Dublin South-West? Join @CarlyBee25, @1GaryGannon and @AnaCosgrave tomorrow in the Glashaus Hotel, Tallaght as we se…

RT @DublinRepeal8: #Donegal contributed 32,559 YES votes to national result
#DubCentral contributed 18,559
A YES in Donegal is as good as…
@SarahClarkin @clare_od Nope! I love ye, I’m very proud of you today, and the world should know this. https://t.co/D8eQYHZWui
@SarahClarkin @clare_od ... of which there are many! 😎 I will not apologise for being in touch with my feelings, Sarah.. No matter how unrelenting your ridiculing becomes. 😐
@clare_od @SarahClarkin ☺️ Definitely Sarah’s influence! I’m also getting better at Instagram but it’s been a slower process..
@clare_od @SarahClarkin ☺️ I’m loving this reference to my facebook post!
@mairenihuigin @SarahClarkin Hey Mary, while we’re on the subjects of hero’s.. ☺️ Thank you. You were brilliant in this campaign.

@SarahClarkin I’ve posted this to 4 separate platforms now- ye don’t have to respond to each one! ☺️
😘😘😘
@PeterTanham @SarahClarkin She says you’re kinda ok at times yourself Peter.. ☺️

My last post on this- my referendum hero is also my best friend in the world, @SarahClarkin 💜 She has been immense for so many years but the last couple of months has become a giant. Forever grateful for our friendship, and her contribution to our Republic. #Together4Yes https://t.co/lupfpJPTfS

My sincerest, and absolute thanks go to those hero’s who’ve been fighting for the removal of the eight amendment since 1983.
There’s a couple of other issues we need to talk about now however.. but we’ll leave those for another day. 💜 https://t.co/IJODVEahHl

We have a fairly amazing country.
Our people are kind, compassionate, and trusting.
I’m now looking forward to a life of minding my business about a persons reproductive health, and choices.
Thank you all for talking with me, and others like me these past few years. https://t.co/D91p2uxXa1
RT @sweetoblivion26: Here’s what it was like at the RDS today #8thref https://t.co/TVTBtl3btw

@AmnestyIreland @roisiningle @lucymwatmough @TaraFlynn Great post but I hope you don’t mind me adding the fourth woman in that picture- @aliceeire has been an absolute hero to Progressive politics for years!
@GooglePuns @heatherbetsy @kateikavanagh @CunninghamLaura @carey_fiona @eilistweets @LizdoyleS @UnaMullally @roisiningle @TaraFlynn @SimonHarrisTD @drboylan @ailbhes Thanks Amanda.
@realBenConnolly ☺️
@LewisRooney Thanks a million pal! It’s been incredible to be part of it.
And then some. 💜 https://t.co/sC3ddNc59R
💜 https://t.co/EkxN88Mmrs
RT @SocDems: #dublincentral counting.... #Together4YES #repealthe8th #8thRef @Oddzer @1GaryGannon https://t.co/aMi90GRDWi
@ElaineByrne @Together4yes Thanks Elaine, enjoy the day and hopefully see you soon.
@NiamhPitts It’s been incredible.
RT @SarahClarkin: It’s #YesDay! #together4yes https://t.co/gtOoZPTttR

@ElaineByrne @Together4yes I doubt it- For vanity more than anything else, I wish we were higher in polls but it won’t happen for several election cycles. The foundations are strong though- Our members/ branches are embedded throughout the country which would be a better measurement of progress.
@lisa_doye So relieved.
@conorduffy_7 @donaloflynn @ElaineByrne @Together4yes I really appreciate that Conor! It was incredible to be part of this period in Irish history.
@TheDublinDiary @markeetweets And I from you my friend.
@markeetweets @TheDublinDiary Thanks for taken the time to talk with me pal.
@GaryDunne Thanks pal. It was so important.
@dlooney And to you my friend. 💜
There are no words to describe how proud I am of this little country. 😭 #Together4Yes https://t.co/C9T51Qmhc9
@conorduffy_7 @ElaineByrne @Together4yes I remember well Conor- hope you’re well my friend.
@dara_mcgann @ElaineByrne @Together4yes @AengusOMaolain @cianocallaghan1 ☺️ Fair enough..
@rgpboyle_boyle 50 meters but I’m seeing posters outside lots of polling stations.
RT @NeddyArkins: Irish women are sound ❤️🇮🇪 #IVotedYes https://t.co/OtULrSijwp
RT @AmybSmyth: Today is the day. Get out and vote because you can be sure that all the No voters will! They think we are young, stupid and…
@MickGaskin10 @SarahClarkin @mariebrod ☺️ That’s my nerves settled now..
RT @MickGaskin10: You can tell your brothers I’m all set for tomorrow @1GaryGannon Spent last attaching new string for my pens!! #VoteYes h…

@ElaineByrne Hey Elaine, tonight isn’t really the night for bickering, but I’d suggest tagging literally any local @Together4yes group throughout the country, and they will tell you exactly were the members of the #SocDems were.
I love this country. https://t.co/4gBlHN4UgN
Before anything is declared, I just want to extend my absolute thanks to every single person that worked on the @Together4yes campaign. Incredible job!
#Gannons4Yes https://t.co/VDln8calhB

I’m all for unseating Ronan Mullen- while doing so, let’s not forget that the graduates of NUI gave us the wonderful Alice Mary Higgins who alongside Trinity’s Lynn Ruane, has been immense in the Seanad. https://t.co/2HcAWe3JfC

I do love an auld Abraham Lincoln quote but this one seems quite appropriate for today;
“You can’t escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.”
Spend today talking with people- have those final, potentially difficult conversations with loved ones.
#Together4Yes
@jemb123 ... @DublinRepeal8 are doing a mass leaflet drop of the entire constituency at 7pm tomorrow! There’ll be no resting until the final bell tolls! ☺️ #Together4Yes #Blitz4Yes
RT @ConalThomas: Piece I wrote nearly two years ago. They're still fighting this fight. "It has to change, it has to become more humanise…
RT @SkyNews: Savita's life would have been saved if she had been allowed to have an abortion - now her parents are urging Ireland to vote t…
@AnaCosgrave @Mac_Lanky That’s a peculiar looking face I have there! ☺️ I look normal here. 👀 https://t.co/2dj1t61uyj
RT @W_J_Peters: Miriam Lord calls out the consistent hypocrisy of politicians such as @mattiemcgrathtd @RonanMullen @eamonocuiv @Toibin1 to…
@Trickstersworld Happy birthday Mr. Groves. 💜
@1rorycowan @carmelbreheny @SimonHarrisTD Thanks Rory!
@Claire_McS @SimonHarrisTD https://t.co/1rL4TgFvxP
@angiebeeb @SimonHarrisTD Tina knows.

My Ma just rang me to ask was I also cheering on @SimonHarrisTD because she felt guilty about punching the air in delight every time he “dragged that shinner outta it”
She’s confident that “Mary Lou will get rid of him” though.. ☺️ Here’s hoping. #rtept
RT @Together4yes: The nation was due to be addressed from the Primetime plinth by eminent consultant obstetrician and gynaecologist Prof Ma…
RT @kim_guerin1: @1GaryGannon @SocDems The epic side eye 😂 https://t.co/NRiuOO6uHM
@kim_guerin1 @SocDems It was just the most perfect side eye I’ve ever seen. 👁
Professor Mary Higgins is my hero. #rtept
@Bubblenoma You’re doing an incredible job!
@John_the_Champ @Toibin1 I thought it was for the right to self-determination? Surely that right must extend to personal autonomy for the person, and not just a luxury of the privileged.

As a self- described Irish Republican, why do you continue to support a system that discriminates unfairly against low income women and other vulnerable groups who cannot afford, or are prohibited from travelling abroad? #rtept

Tonight’s 1st question to @Toibin1 - “Deputy, as an Irish Nationalist, is there any part of you at all that deems it hypocritical to support the continued exile of Irish women to UK Hospitals for health care procedures deemed entirely safe & necessary by the WHO?
RT @GrainneFallon: What if ? @1GaryGannon https://t.co/n4ci3FcY9Y
@TheDublinDiary ☺️ The officer in the polling station will have it removed on Friday.. Don’t be touching it! 😅
@TheDublinDiary It needs to be 50 metres from the polling station on polling day!

This is my cousin Michelle. I’ve always been proud to call her that. She’s kind, helpful, and very strong.
Today though, my admiration for her has grown that little bit more. This is a tough story to share (and read) but it’s so important. #8thRef
https://t.co/UXi4AKYxGc

Poverty kills. The eradication of modern destitution must be the unifying challenge of the next decade. https://t.co/GGpuW2oAyd

RT @SarahClarkin: I hear John “tax children’s shoes” Bruton is out, talking about loving both 🙄🙄🙄🙄 #yourYESmatters
RT @mrsscanlan: Any of my Northside friends, get on it. Might try to get free myself... https://t.co/Ga0eNYC4ok

@taradeacy He’s somebody I’ve known since we were both very young- really decent guy. Only recently reconnecting with him but I’m so impressed by the work he’s doing. (He’s the one who brings me down to beat the kids on fifa.... and talk a little about politics while doing it.) ☺️

The Belvedere/ Nickol are really great projects in the Inner City. Immense work being done by good people like Johnathan Dowling and Gillian.
I’m still undefeated at FIFA down there though.. They keep lining up “the best in the area” and I keep handing out 4-nil whoopings.. 👀👍 https://t.co/wOE3mxH3Ls
@BryanMallon93 I’m loving it to- was dying for an excuse to use it! ☺️

Scrolling through me Facebook page, taking the names of the lads giving out that RTE showed the Royal Wedding, but seem to have no issue at all with Irish women being exiled to UK Hospitals for basic healthcare. https://t.co/2zgv1Ct8Lq
@peterkinvara Congrats Peter! Looking forward to meeting you soon, and working alongside you for years to come. 💜
@lisa_doye @DublinRepeal8 @Together4yes @SocDems @SenLynnRuane Hey Lisa- absolutely!
RT @drvconway: Great opportunity to talk through issues in my local area tomorrow evening #Together4Yes https://t.co/WSYwne1jUZ
If you have a relative or friend, who might have some questions about the referendum- please bring them along tomorrow. #Chat4Yes. https://t.co/nITM6ZmSrn

@angiebeeb @bfcdublin She also has three tattoos! ☺️

@martinward79 @bfcdublin Ah I haven’t swapped from anything in fairness. I’ve been a shit league of Ireland supporter the last decade- I’ve been to Old Trafford more times each season than Tolka.. 🤦‍♂️ Would love to see the league develop though- I believe it has massive potential.

We went to see @bfcdublin in Dalymount last night for the 1st time in a long time.. The result wasn’t great but there was something very lovely, & welcoming about the atmosphere in the stadium. The redevelopment presents a very exciting opportunity for football on the Northside. https://t.co/MKqYoNI65q
